channel.title: Github Pages on Adam Coding Corner
channel.description: Recent content in Github Pages on Adam Coding Corner

item.title: Ultimate Github Page Deployment
item.description: Mr Hyde Text you are reading is available on Jekyll blog hosted on GitHub, with the use of free Github Pages. Long story short: Jekyll is a template engine changing markdown documents on static HTML webpages, that you can then host anywyere, because you don’t need databases or server that has PHP or Python. Usual process Normally process of adding new post looks like this: I write markdown document with setting parameters like title, date and tags when I’m happy with what I wrote (never), I commit changes and push it to repository on GitHub.
